3020.58.text:
where we are investing
significant funds

3022.78.text:
in supporting state and school
systems it is specifically

3027.70.text:
contemplated that
amongst those other issues

3030.63.text:
of greater autonomy are
included a greater provision

3034.29.text:
and opportunity for parents,
PNCs, participation in boards

3038.53.text: and the like to take place.

3040.66.text:
There's a question
down here on table 3.

3048.05.text:
>> Hi Peter, Paul [inaudible]
Minister for Education.

3051.36.text: Before I ask a question again

3052.86.text:
about independent public schools
I'll just preface it by saying

3058.18.text:
I don't actually yet
have a view with regard

3064.08.text:
I welcome your observation that
any analysis of the success

3067.76.text:
of IPS must include the
impact on non-IPS schools

3070.75.text: and the rest of the system.

3072.76.text:
And to that end I would
ask is it your view

3078.77.text:
that ultimately we identify the
benefits of IPS and provide them

3082.48.text: to every school in the system?

3084.54.text:
Or, is it your view that that
may not physically be possible

3089.00.text:
and we have to come up
with some other solution?

3092.89.text:
>> Well, thanks for
the question, Paul.

3095.59.text:
And it's something that I very
much hope you may have the

3098.05.text:
opportunity to chew
on at some stage, too.

3103.33.text:
I think with the IPS schools
we're at an early period

3117.31.text:
And it's a cliche for
me to say that, A,

3120.52.text: one size doesn't fit all and, B,

3127.70.text:
and regional circumstances
that attach to schools

3131.19.text:
and the desirability that they
may feel to take that step.

3136.18.text:
I'm not trying to
duck the question,

3137.53.text:
but I don't think we know
the answer to that yet.

3139.81.text:
And that's what's
exciting about it.

3142.23.text:
But I respond to what
the parent said earlier.

3144.75.text:
It is the case, and
some who specialise

3149.43.text:
in this area will know this,
that the research tends

3153.37.text:
to suggest that greater degrees
of school autonomy will lead

3161.25.text:
Now, I think as we work
through that, whether it's

3163.79.text:
in western Australia with their
independent public schools

3166.90.text:
model, or whether it's in
other states which are looking

3170.00.text:
at autonomy across a
continuum, we have to judge

3173.24.text:
and evaluate firstly whether
that is being delivered at all.

3177.58.text:
And in this case where you
already have a number of schools

3180.11.text:
that have taken the IPS
route whether, in fact,

3182.61.text:
you're seeing an overall
potential increase

3186.25.text:
in opportunity for students
and education results.

3190.59.text:
Final comment, there's
a huge difference

3193.95.text:
between a small school, say
for example in peri-urban area,

3200.23.text:
or in a regional or rural
area, which is drawing a number

3206.22.text:
of kids from lower socioeconomic
backgrounds, and a school say,

3210.78.text:
for example, in a Perth suburb
drawing a student population

3216.38.text:
from middle or higher
socioeconomic backgrounds

3220.08.text:
in terms of the capacity
that the leadership

3222.93.text:
of that school has to utilise
the capacities that exist

3227.71.text:
within a school community
including the parent community.

3231.14.text:
So it is very much
a case of both those

3235.45.text:
who run the education
system, school leaders

3238.83.text:
in the communities
themselves coming to agreement

3242.49.text: about how they want to advance

3246.19.text:
Now, here in western Australia
whilst there's conjecture

3249.33.text:
and debate around the matters
that have come off the floor

3252.49.text:
and the questions and your
question, too, Paul to me,

3255.16.text:
I think the answer is that
you're on that journey,

3257.81.text: and so are many other schools

3261.66.text:
And now fortunately
we have an opportunity

3263.80.text:
of assessing whether the
journey is a successful one

3265.97.text:
through things like NAPLAN
and otherwise and, again,

3269.00.text:
when the review that
was referred

3270.13.text:
into the earlier question
arise a better answer

3273.03.text:
or more thorough I guess
answer about the desirability,

3276.64.text:
the impact and the
effect it may be having

3279.22.text: on non-IPS schools can be given.

3281.41.text:
>> One more question

Is the aim to try and have the

some of the outcomes

It's not about funding

3300.72.text:
I know there's a

3304.82.text:
Is the plan for the 2013
budget [inaudible] have

3308.98.text:
>> John, the answer to that

that I gave when we had this

3314.80.text:
I'm not talking about
upcoming budgets in relation

3318.35.text:
to the funding review

that that is the first order

3331.26.text:
of business that we

3333.33.text:
And I am convinced that the
most prudent way of going

3337.61.text:
through a debate which
has derailed politicians

3342.37.text:
and political parties in the
past is to take that approach.

3346.57.text:
>> Sure. Okay, we have

and it has to be extremely

3352.67.text:
It's there, but it has to be

So a quick question

3361.76.text:
>> My question revolves around

3387.96.text:
and what the expectations

3390.55.text:

I haven't read it in its full

3398.20.text:
But we've certainly got
some issues here in WA

3402.04.text:
on how PNCs are perceived
and the tension between them

3406.10.text:
Would you like to

3407.61.text: and please give us some insight.

3411.05.text:
>> Well, Mr. Gonski's panel
didn't directly consider

3416.59.text:
We have a view generally
as a national government

3421.97.text:
that the views and the voices
of parents both should be heard

3428.66.text:
And that parents are clearly
extremely important stakeholders

3433.67.text:
in the education
of their children.

3436.32.text:
We recognise that
there are a range

3439.67.text:
of sometimes complex issues
around the relationships

3444.10.text:
between PNCs and specific
schools, and sometimes

3452.62.text:
And we encourage, again,
recognising the diversity

3456.85.text:
of the education
system that we do have,

3460.13.text:
the relevant authorities,
principals and others

3464.44.text:
to speak openly and work through
issues that may be of concern.

3469.60.text:
Just to finish in case it
does sound a little bit

3473.19.text:
like a generalisation, I was
asked the question earlier

3477.57.text:
on about what recourse does
somebody have if they go

3481.20.text:
to the My School website and
they find that the school

3485.07.text:
in their local community
that they're thinking

3486.99.text:
of sending their kids
to isn't performing

3489.91.text: as well as a similar school.

3492.14.text:
Because remember My
School really only looks

3494.61.text:
at similar schools
by way of comparison.

3498.95.text:
And, of course, the answer
to that is for the parent

3503.68.text:
to interact with the school
itself, with the principal

3507.95.text: and the teachers in the school.

3510.66.text:
And I'm very confident
that if it's an open

3514.47.text:
and thorough interaction
entered into in good faith then

3519.00.text:
in the vast majority of
cases people are satisfied

3523.13.text:
with both what they hear by
way of response to issues

3527.90.text:
that the school itself is
better informed about the views

3531.77.text:
of parents that are thinking
of sending their kids there

3535.97.text:
The days in which what
happened when your child went

3540.26.text:
into the classroom and
came out the other end

3542.76.text:
and what the school is doing
you could only really glean

3545.81.text:
from a conversation in the
tack shop or getting it

3548.71.text:
out of your kid when
they came home are over.

3551.87.text:
Which for those that have
adolescents isn't probably a bad

3554.62.text:
thing, because sometimes you
don't get a lot of information

3556.74.text:
when you ask the question,
especially the boys I know.

3559.16.text:
I don't have boys
but I know that.

3561.90.text:
So we're at a really exciting

3565.79.text:
that have got a little
bit of edge to them

3567.54.text:
and where there may be different

3571.28.text:
in front of us, more
transparency,

3573.84.text:
more understanding and, frankly,
a very strong commitment

3577.72.text: to improve all schools as if you

3580.17.text:
like the foundations
for that discussion.

3582.96.text:
And so I encourage it
to continue fruitfully.

in being flexible

3728.94.text:
who has outlined comprehensively
